pkgmetadata.longdescription:
READ THIS BEFORE USING THIS PACKAGE.
Official Gentoo packaging of NetworkManager >=1.42.6 unconditionally sets a nondefault build-time option (-Dmodify_system=true) that allows ALL logged in users to modify system connections, including reading network credentials (https://bugs.gentoo.org/905668). This ebuild provides a patch to the configure script that disables the logic behind this option, so that network settings are again protected from untrusted users and programs.
This ebuild is package.masked by default as it has the potential to break the build of NetworkManager, especially on ~arch when a new version of NetworkManager is released and the patch no longer applies cleanly. My main focus is on keeping a healthy build for stable, but pings are welcome if things break on unstable.
This ebuild will collect patches for multiple versions of NetworkManager. The current latest patch will be placed in the unversioned /etc/portage/patches/net-misc/networkmanager directory. Patches for versions of NetworkManager older than the latest patch will be placed in versioned /etc/portage/patches/net-misc/networkmanager-NNN directories.
After installing this package for the first time, rebuilding net-misc/networkmanager is required.
